title: David Beckham is mates with BLACKPINK as they unite in South Korea
text:
To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

Seems everyone in the world is mates with BLACKPINK as David Beckham became the latest celebrity to hang out with the pop group.

The former professional footballer is in South Korea alongside the K-pop band – made up of Jisso, Jennie, Lisa and Rosé – when he was trolled by James Corden this week.

Going to the extremes of filming a personal video for his mate Becks, James seemed quite let down he wasn’t invited along to South Korea where David is currently working.

‘It’s me, your dearest friend, James,’ the presenter began, from behind his The Late Late Show desk.

Advertisement

Advertisement

‘Now it’s recently come to my attention you sir are in Korea…

David was repping the Adidas (Picture: Rex Features)

He seemed happy to be in good company (Picture: Rex Features)

‘I mean, no call, no text, didn’t even slide into my DMs. And apparently you’re being presented with your very own Korean name, well good for you.’

James kept trolling, as he continued: ‘No, really, I’ll just be in LA, all alone, with my stupid regular English name.’

Blackpink is killing it right now(Picture: Rich Fury/Getty Images for Coachella)

David took to Instagram to share the clip of James with his fomo.

‘Your invitation must have been lost in the post @j_corden,’ David wrote.

‘Excited to be in Seoul today, see you soon @blackpinkofficial !’

The group reposted the video, showing they were all on board the whole thing.

How did we miss this fresh BFF situation!?

David is in the city to celebrate the 70th anniversary of Adidas alongside the girl group, who have been Adidas ambassadors since last year.

They’ll be joined by CL and and WINNER’s Mino during the celebrations.

The Manchester United legend was at Times Square Yeongdeungpo to commemorate the launch of the brand’s Ultraboost with fans able to pick up a signed pair of the kicks.

David isn’t the first to show their stan-dedication to the Kill This Love hitmakers, though, after Shawn Mendes recently declared his allegiance.

Everyone is mates with the group (Picture: Shawn Mendes)

The Senorita singer was clearly thrilled to be meeting the stars as he grinned away in a black and white photo with Lisa, Jennie and Jisoo.

Advertisement

Advertisement

Collab, anyone?

Fans were obsessed with the 21-year-old’s photo, with one writing: ‘MY GIRLS!!!’ and another understandably freaking out and adding: ‘Omgomgomggggomfgggggg.’

Meanwhile, Miley Cyrus has followed Rosé on Instagram and, truly, what took her so long?

Despite everyone hoping for a collaboration, fans believe that Miley followed Rosé as a form of appreciation after they noticed that Rosé posted a screenshot of Miley’s song Slide Away on her Instagram story.

Who will join the Blackpink army next?
